message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.AI. 

The paper deals with image processing and computer vision, specifically the computation of spatial image convolutions for event cameras. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also discusses the use of the proposed method in real-time robotic systems, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.RO (Robotics). The approach involves the use of an internal state that encodes convolved image information, which could be of interest to researchers in machine learning and neural networks, making cs.LG (Machine Learning) a likely category as well. The paper also proposes a method for corner detection, which falls under the category of cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing). Finally, the use of the proposed method for real-time vision algorithms suggests that it could also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence).
